The system is subject to an impulse response represented as a transformation \\(g(x) = Ax + Bu\\), where A and B are matrices and u denotes the control input.

If an intervention through a new transformation \\(h(x) = Dx + Eu\\) is applied at time \\(t_1\\), will the state of the system \\(x(T)\\) for T > t_1 depend solely on the original setup's parameters (p and q) and not on A, B, D, or E?
Explanation: Applying the intervention adds another layer of complexity, altering the subsequent trajectory of the mechanical system. The final state \\(x(T)\\) will depend on the aggregate effects of the transformations (A, B, D, E) along with the system's inherent properties described by p and q.
